column4: hey- can someone help explain something to me? i am trying to sudo apt-get install xinerama, although the error  E: Couldn't find package xinerama
there is no such package. xinerama is an old extension of xwindows

aww- ok. so what would be a good dual monitor software? my google keeps pulling me back to that. And the software is tring to make my second monitor the main monitor. Other than when i try to correct it- it combines them.. i think i have an xorg issue- but im not too good at diagnoising this- does the xorg have a log i can view to make sure it is running correctly?
if you have nvidia with prop drivers use nvidia-settings/twinview
nah i have ati. And i am trying to use display- thats whats messing me up. Its not properly idenitfying the monitors
i do not have multiple monitors. can't help further. maybe ati propietary drivers have its own tool too
um- i have run across Xorg configs to work with.. but thats y im asking. I had a missing xorg to begin with.. so im not even sure what the computer is using as a default thanks alot.
newer Xwindows do not need the file they just autoconfigure themselves at runtime, if xorg.conf is present is obeyed though
oh- ididnt know that. Well thanks you've been of great help.. imma get lunch now..
dunno; never done a screencast myself
move the home folder and use the steps in the clone factoid
to move the home folder just tar it up « tar cvzpf /path/to/data/disk/home_backup.tar.gz $HOME »
depending on what you tweked installed you may want to transfer spome files from /etc/
ya, im going to run into some issues with that, but i havent gotten to far in this installation- Thats y im doing this, getting my practice for up and go.
you may have to chown the entire home to the new user
